DataElement.preferredName: Post Clinical Trial Therapeutic Procedure Treatment Regimen Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of chemotherapy regimens received after protocol therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Domain Post Clinical Trial Therapeutic Procedure Treatment Regimen
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Property.preferredName: Post Clinical Trial Therapeutic Procedure Treatment Regimen
Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 4188776 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
